rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 11: Line 11:
==Work==
==Work==
â
[[File:Mexico City 1968 Summer Olympics logo.svg|thumb|300px|right|Wyman's logo for the 1968 Olympics.]]
 
Wyman, who has been described as a "rock star" of graphic arts,<ref name = "WaPo" /> made his reputation when he designed the logo for the 1968 Summer Olympic Games. He has also designed icons for museums and many other institutions, individualized signs for buildings at the U.S. [[Smithsonian National Zoological Park|National Zoo]], and many other symbols. Perhaps his most enduring design is the stylized route map he devised for the [[Washington Metro]] in the mid-1970s, showing routes, stations, transfer points, and certain landmarks in a clear fashion, although distances are not to scale.<ref name = "WaPo" /> In 2011, Wyman was called on to design a new Metro map, able to depict planned new lines and route orientations, as well as some station names that have been expanded to the point of being cumbersome.<ref>Steve Delahoyde, [http://www.mediabistro.com/unbeige/lance-wyman-difficult-task-of-re-designing-his-original-dc-metro-map_b14488 Lance Wyman Difficult Task of Re-Designing His Original DC Metro Map], Mediabistro.com, Unbeige, June 6, 2011.</ref><ref>Dana Hedgpeth, "Metro's Main Designer", ''Express'' (Washington, D.C.), June 6, 2011, p. 12.</ref>
Wyman, who has been described as a "rock star" of graphic arts,<ref name = "WaPo" /> made his reputation when he designed the logo for the 1968 Summer Olympic Games. He has also designed icons for museums and many other institutions, individualized signs for buildings at the U.S. [[Smithsonian National Zoological Park|National Zoo]], and many other symbols. Perhaps his most enduring design is the stylized route map he devised for the [[Washington Metro]] in the mid-1970s, showing routes, stations, transfer points, and certain landmarks in a clear fashion, although distances are not to scale.<ref name = "WaPo" /> In 2011, Wyman was called on to design a new Metro map, able to depict planned new lines and route orientations, as well as some station names that have been expanded to the point of being cumbersome.<ref>Steve Delahoyde, [http://www.mediabistro.com/unbeige/lance-wyman-difficult-task-of-re-designing-his-original-dc-metro-map_b14488 Lance Wyman Difficult Task of Re-Designing His Original DC Metro Map], Mediabistro.com, Unbeige, June 6, 2011.</ref><ref>Dana Hedgpeth, "Metro's Main Designer", ''Express'' (Washington, D.C.), June 6, 2011, p. 12.</ref>
